instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
fan spins for a second then shuts off

corrosion around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> area 
mostly between <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR>

tried replacing <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> with a known good. no change.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0v

<RESISTOR>R8168</RESISTOR> is 99oms
noticed that if <RESISTOR>R8168</RESISTOR> is removed then <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 3.3v and fan stays on
still no chime or image on screen tho.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Problem on DDR power supply.
Its power good pulls down to ground <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

Post resistance to ground at L7430 and some voltages for <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>; pins 6, 12, 16, 17.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> and traces are good.
You may need to change <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and/or <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
L7430 pin1 0.7K ohms
L7430 pin2 0.7K ohms

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin6 0v
<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin12 5v
?????<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin16 0v
<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin17 22.8mV

from <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR> is OL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"from <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR> is OL."
Do you mean no connection between R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR>???

"?????<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin16 0v"
Check voltage on both sides of <RESISTOR>R8111</RESISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
sorry for late reply. 
yes fromc7425 to <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR> there is no connection
voltage is 0v on both sides of <RESISTOR>R8111</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
As per schematic R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> are both connected; supposedly corroded trace in your case.
Be aware, <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR> gets usually fried in such case...
